word_mean: 冲动：突然、不可控制的决定要行动的冲动
作用在物体上的力使物体的动量在某一时段内发生变化的度量，其值等于力和其作用时间的乘积。
又称“冲击脉冲”。（1）一种持续期极短的信号。（2）电压（居多）或电流的一种无方向的短暂突发。

sentence.Network_en: All day she had fought off the impulse to telephone Harry.
sentence.Network_cn: 她一整天都在克制自己想给哈里打电话的冲动。

sentence.Network_en: Sean's a fast thinker, and he acts on impulse.
sentence.Network_cn: 肖恩是个思维敏捷、行事随兴的人。

sentence.Network_en: After lunch she decided on impulse to take a bath.
sentence.Network_cn: 午饭后她突然兴起，决定洗个澡。

精神疾患中，以冲动性(impulsivity)为主要行为症状表现者所在多有，如冲动控制疾患(impulse control disorder)、性到错(paraphilia)中.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (as a verb in the sense 'give an impulse to'): the verb from Latin impuls- 'driven on', the noun from impulsus 'impulsion, outward pressure', both from the verb impellere (see impel)

entry.def: An impulse is a sudden desire to do something.

example.ex: Unable to resist the impulse, he glanced at the sea again...
example.tran: 他抑制不住冲动,又向海面瞥了一眼。

example.ex: He still couldn't understand the impulse that had made him confide in Cassandra...
example.tran: 他仍然难以理解是什么样的冲动使他向卡桑德拉吐露了秘密。

entry.def: An impulse is a short electrical signal that is sent along a wire or nerve or through the air, usually as one of a series.
An impulse buy or impulse purchase is something that you decide to buy when you see it, although you had not planned to buy it.

example.ex: The curtains were an impulse buy.
example.tran: 窗帘是一时兴起买下的。

entry.def: If you do something on impulse, you suddenly decide to do it, without planning it.

example.ex: Sean's a fast thinker, and he acts on impulse...
example.tran: 肖恩是个思维敏捷、行事随兴的人。

example.ex: After lunch she decided on impulse to take a bath.
example.tran: 午饭后她突然兴起,决定洗个澡。

means.word_mean: 3. the electrical discharge that travels along a nerve fiber;

sentences.sentence: "they demonstrated the transmission of impulses from the cortex to the hypothalamus"

means.word_mean: 4. (electronics) a sharp transient wave in the normal electrical state (or a series of such transients);

sentences.sentence: "the pulsations seemed to be coming from a star"

means.word_mean: 5. the act of applying force suddenly;

sentences.sentence: "the car's momentum carried it off the road"

auth_sentence.content: There's no impulse drive, no warp drive.

auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Robuck was driven by a similar revisionist impulse.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必须做的,强制性的,[课程]必修的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+puls驱动,推+ory……的→共同推的→强制性的
impulse[v.冲动]+ive……的→adj.易冲动的,感情用事的
repulse[n.&v.驱逐,击退,厌恶]+ive……的→adj.令人厌恶的,驱逐的
com共同+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→共同推→强制
ex出+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→推出去→驱逐
pro向前+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→向前推
puls驱动,推+e→n.脉搏,脉冲
push=puls驱动,推→n.&v.推, 推动
re回+puls驱动,推+e→推回去→击退,驱逐
im内+pulse跳动→内在推动→冲动
pulse[n.脉搏,脉冲]+ate表动词→v.有规律的振动,[脉]搏动

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"向内,成为,进入,使……"; 2. 表示"不,无,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: im向内,成为,进入,使……+passion激情+ed……的→adj.慷慨激昂的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+plic重叠+it→进入重叠→不直说→储蓄的
im不,无,非+moral道德的→adj.不道德的
im不,无,非+mortal死的→adj.不朽的
im不,无,非+mutable可变的→adj.不变的
im不,无,非+partial有偏见的→adj.公平的
im不,无,非+pass感情+ive……的→没感情
im不,无,非+pecc斑点+able……的→无斑点的
im不,无,非+polite礼貌的→adj.无礼的
im不,无,非+possible可能的→adj.不可能的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+migrate移居→入住
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pel推→推进,驱动
im向内,成为,进入,使……+peril危险→v.使处于危险中
im向内,成为,进入,使……+person人+ate表动词→进入别人→扮演别人
im向内,成为,进入,使……+prison监狱→v.监禁
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pulse跳动→内在推动→冲动

Sentence.sentence: Many of them buy things on impulse.
The problem is that such an impulse is hard to sustain Across the country, many similar families were unable to maintain the initial boost in morale(士气).

means.word_mean: 凭冲动行事, 突如其来的念头

sentences.en: He felt an irresistible impulse to rush into the room.
sentences.cn: 他有一种难以抗拒的冲动想冲进房间。

means.word_mean: 推动, 冲力, 刺激, 推动力

sentences.en: The plan will give an impulse to industrial expansion.
sentences.cn: 这个计划将促进工业的扩展。

sentences.en: Impulse is the product of net force and time it is acting.
sentences.cn: 冲量等于物体所受合外力和时间的乘积。

jushi.english: The plan will give an impulse to industrial expansion.
jushi.chinese: 这个计划将促进工业的扩展。

jushi.english: Her first impulse was to walk out and leave him.
jushi.chinese: 她的第一个想法就是走出去离开他。

jushi.english: He felt an irresistible impulse to rush into the room.
jushi.chinese: 他有一种难以抗拒的冲动想冲进房间。
